Detailed Description

simple utilities library

This library embeds all the basic utilities manipulated by higher level TREX components. They are all provided by the library named lib/libTREXutils

Author:
Frederic Py <fpy@mbari.org>

Define Documentation

TREX_SYSLOG_NAME [related, inherited]

syslog identifier

This identifier is usd when the log is sent to syslog. It is the name given as the source of the message

Definition at line 64 of file Plugin.hh.

typedef BasicSymbol<char> TREX::utils::Symbol

char based BasicSymbol

This typedef is the default type one would use to manipulate symbols. It is the counterpart of the standard C++ string class.

Definition at line 325 of file Symbol.hh.

Function Documentation

std::string TREX::utils::checked_string ( char const *  str  )  [inline]

Checked char * to std::string conversion

Parameters:
str A C string

This convert a C string to a std::string checking if str is not NULL. Indeed std::string does not check it and std::string(NULL) has an undefined behavior.

Returns:
A std::string corresponding to the value of str. If str is NULL, it returns an empty std::string.

Author:
Patrick Daley
std::string const & TREX::utils::internals::p_dlext (  ) 

Dynamic library extension helper.

This function helps to identify the usual extension of dynamic libraries for the current platform. Indeed, depending on the OS this extension differ.

The cases that are supported now are:

  • .so for linux and most of the UNIXes
  • .dylib under MacOS X
  • .dll under Windows
Returns:
The usual dynamic library extension for this platform
See also:
void *p_dlopen(const char *, int)
Author:
Frederic Py <fpy@mbari.org>

Referenced by TREX::utils::PluginLoader::load().

template<class Ty >
Ty TREX::utils::parse_attr ( Ty const &  on_missing,
rapidxml::xml_node<> const &  node,
std::string const &  attr 
) [inline]

Optional XML attribute extraction.

Template Parameters:
Ty output type
Parameters:
on_missing default value if missing
node An XML node
attr Attribyute name

This method extract attribute attr from node and parses it as a Ty variable. If the attribute is missing it returns the default on_missing value

Precondition:
the value of attr can be parsed into the type Ty
Exceptions:
bad_string_cast Cannot parse the value of attr as Ty
Return values:
@a on_missing If attr does not exist in node
Returns:
The parsed value from attr otherwise
See also:
template<class Ty> Ty const &parse_attr(rapidxml::xml_node<> const &, std::string const &attr)
